text: Jean Joseph Victor Génissieu (29 October 1749 – 27 October 1804) was a French lawyer and politician. He was president of the National Convention, Minister of Justice and president of the Council of Five Hundred during the French Revolution. Category:1749 births Category:1804 deaths Category:French lawyers Category:Politicians from Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes Category:Presidents of the National Convention Category:People from Drôme
title: Jean Joseph Victor Génissieu
